bug.author: revikiran1991
bug.summary: The C++ compiler "/usr/bin/clang++-8" is not able to compile a simple test program
bug.description:
I am trying to compile Carla 0.9.9 on ubuntu18.04: I get the following error: <denchmark-code>-- The C compiler identification is Clang 8.0.1 -- The CXX compiler identification is Clang 8.0.1 -- The ASM compiler identification is Clang -- Found assembler: /usr/bin/clang-8 -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/clang-8 -- Check for working C compiler: /usr/bin/clang-8 -- works -- Detecting C compiler ABI info -- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done -- Detecting C compile features -- Detecting C compile features - done -- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/clang++-8 -- Check for working CXX compiler: /usr/bin/clang++-8 -- broken CMake Error at /usr/share/cmake-3.10/Modules/CMakeTestCXXCompiler.cmake:45 (message): The C++ compiler
"/usr/bin/clang++-8"
is not able to compile a simple test program.
It fails with the following output:
Change Dir: /home/user_name/carla/Build/llvm-8.0-build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp
Run Build Command:"/usr/bin/ninja" "cmTC_7869f" [1/2] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/cmTC_7869f.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o [2/2] Linking CXX executable cmTC_7869f FAILED: cmTC_7869f : && /usr/bin/clang++-8 CMakeFiles/cmTC_7869f.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o -o cmTC_7869f && : /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lstdc++ clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation) ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
CMake will not be able to correctly generate this project. Call Stack (most recent call first): CMakeLists.txt:39 (project)
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred! See also "/home/usr_name/carla/Build/llvm-8.0-build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log". See also "/home/usr_name/carla/Build/llvm-8.0-build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log". Util/BuildTools/Linux.mk:135: recipe for target 'setup' failed make: *** [setup] Error 1 </denchmark-code>
And the CMakeError.log: <denchmark-code>Compiling the CXX compiler identification source file "CMakeCXXCompilerId.cpp" failed. Compiler: /usr/bin/clang++-8 Build flags: Id flags:
The output was: 1 /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lstdc++ clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
Determining if the CXX compiler works failed with the following output: Change Dir: /home/usr_name/carla/Build/llvm-8.0-build/CMakeFiles/CMakeTmp
Run Build Command:"/usr/bin/ninja" "cmTC_90d92" [1/2] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/cmTC_90d92.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o [2/2] Linking CXX executable cmTC_90d92 FAILED: cmTC_90d92 : && /usr/bin/clang++-8 CMakeFiles/cmTC_90d92.dir/testCXXCompiler.cxx.o -o cmTC_90d92 && : /usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lstdc++ clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation) ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed. </denchmark-code>

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/revikiran1991>@revikiran1991</denchmark-link> , first of all, this has nothing to do with CARLA and can be happening because of different causes. To me, the main clue here is here: <denchmark-code>/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lstdc++ </denchmark-code>
And looks like in your case the solution could be in <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2086072/linking-using-g-fails-searching-for-lstdc>this post</denchmark-link> . Hope this helps.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/revikiran1991>@revikiran1991</denchmark-link>
Check after installing libstdc++-8-dev package. This solved issue for me.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
